captions.text:
And this might just be my favorite necklace
ever! Hi guys! It's Sandi and in today's tutorial

I'm going to be showing you how to fix a broken
nail fast! If you've been following me on

Instagram you'll know that last week as I
was packing for LA I ended up breaking my

nail right off. Like, I snapped the whole
white part completely off! As seen here. But

the very next day I uploaded this picture
and a lot of you guys were wondering how I

went from a broken nail to a fixed nail in
one day. So that's what I'm going to be sharing

with you guys today! Also, if you want to
see more tips and tricks videos in the future,

then give this video a thumbs up and let me
know down in the comments what types of tips

and tricks videos you'd like to see! And now
onto the tutorial.

So we all know how much it sucks to have your
nails long, shaped, and pretty and then all

of a sudden you break one right off. But today
I'm going to show you how to go from this
tragedy, to this, in no time!

The first thing you might be thinking when
you break a nail off is that "ugh… now I'm

going to have to cut them all down so they're
matching." But that's not true! My favorite

thing to do is get out a pack of natural looking
fake nails. These ones by KISS are my favorite

right now because they're super easy to apply
and look really natural. They come in many

sizes and also have a little bottle of nail
glue inside the package.

First you just need to find the right size
to fit your nail. I trick I have is to not

use the nail that looks like it will fit without
pressing it onto the nail bed. This is because

when it's pressed it will flatten out a little
and become a little too big for your nail.

This will make the nail look obviously fake.
Instead choose one that looks a little bit

too small when you hold it over your nail.
When you press it down, it should flatten
out a bit and then you have the perfect fit!

To apply, just add a small dot of nail glue
to the nail bed and then press the fake nail

over your broken nail. Make sure to press
down firmly for about 10 seconds. And there

you go! Super quick and easy. I love these
nails because they are really easy to file

and shape just like real nails. Make sure
to file the little bit of plastic off the

very top and then file the nail to the same
shape and length as the rest of your nails.

Then, just paint over it and the nail will
look completely real. No one will even spot

the difference! Just make sure you're using
a nice pack of thin nails like these, as some

can be really bulky and thick and look obviously
fake.

The nail should last about a week. If you
want to take it off sooner, you can dip it
into acetone for 1 minute to remove it.

And that's it for today's video! I hope these
products and tips help you out the next time

you break a nail. Hope to see you again soon!
Take care and I'll seeya next time!
